commit_message: improve fix #72558, while (u>=0) with unsigned int will always be true
cve_desc: Integer overflow in the _gdContributionsAlloc function in gd_interpolation.c in GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memory write or memory consumption) via unspecified vectors.

commit_message:
Bug 701785: fixed sanitizer heap-buffer-overflow in lprn_is_black().

In contrib/lips4/gdevlprn.c:lprn_is_black(), it seems that bpl is not
necessarily a multiple of lprn->nBw, so we need to explicitly avoid straying
into the next line's data.

This also avoids accessing beyond our buffer if we are already on the last
line, and so fixes the sanitizer error.

Fixes:
    ./sanbin/gs -sOutputFile=tmp -sDEVICE=lips2p ../bug-701785.pdf
cve_desc: A buffer overflow vulnerability in lprn_is_black() in contrib/lips4/gdevlprn.c of Artifex Software GhostScript v9.50 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service via a crafted PDF file. This is fixed in v9.51.

commit_message:
Bug 701785: fixed sanitizer heap-buffer-overflow in lprn_is_black().

In contrib/lips4/gdevlprn.c:lprn_is_black(), it seems that bpl is not
necessarily a multiple of lprn->nBw, so we need to explicitly avoid straying
into the next line's data.

This also avoids accessing beyond our buffer if we are already on the last
line, and so fixes the sanitizer error.

Fixes:
    ./sanbin/gs -sOutputFile=tmp -sDEVICE=lips2p ../bug-701785.pdf
cve_desc: A buffer overflow vulnerability in lprn_is_black() in contrib/lips4/gdevlprn.c of Artifex Software GhostScript v9.50 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service via a crafted PDF file. This is fixed in v9.51.

commit_message:
patch 8.2.4901: NULL pointer access when using invalid pattern

Problem:    NULL pointer access when using invalid pattern.
Solution:   Check for failed regexp program.
cve_desc: NULL Pointer Dereference in function vim_regexec_string at regexp.c:2729 in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4901. NULL Pointer Dereference in function vim_regexec_string at regexp.c:2729 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted input.

commit_message:
